definition: to present, advocate, or demand earnestly or pressingly
examples: his conviction was upheld on a theory never urged at his … trial

definition: to undertake the accomplishment of with energy, swiftness, or enthusiasm
to serve as a motive or reason for
examples: urged by a sense of duty

definition: to force or impel in an indicated direction or into motion or greater speed
examples: the dog urged the sheep toward the gate

definition: to declare, advance, or press earnestly a statement, argument, charge, or claim
examples: urged for the adoption of the proposal

definition: the act or process of urging
a force or impulse that urges, a continuing impulse toward an activity or goal
